bill_title: appropriate money for the State Fair.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to appropriate money for the State Fair. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby appropriated from the South Dakota bred-racing fund the sum of one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the State Fair. Section 2. There is hereby appropriated from the special racing revolving fund the sum of one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the State Fair. Section 3. The funds appropriated in sections 1 and 2 of this Act shall be shall be used to replace the 4-H beef barn. Any remaining funds shall be used for maintenance and repair on State Fair facilities. Section 4. The secretary of the Department of Agriculture shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 5. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 2003, shall revert in accordance with § 4-8-21. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
